page.title: 09ANCHOR CHURCH
page.content: Anchor church is not really a church, but a cave in the Bunter sandstone just along the river from Ingleby villge. It is called a church because at some time in the past an anchorite or hermit lived there and shaped holes in the rock to look like church windows. Anchorites were people who for religious reasons chose to live alone often in remote places. No-one is sure of the date when it was first called Anchor Church but in the records of 1658 there is an entry which tells of a burial at Anchor Church of "ye foole of Anchor Church".
